H0.text: Polar and nonpolar are the two terms that designate how well aqueous solutions conduct electricity.

H1.text: Secular and nonpolar are the two terms that designate how well aqueous solutions conduct electricity.

H2.text: Filter and nonpolar are the two terms that designate how well aqueous solutions conduct electricity.

H3.text: Hot and nonpolar are the two terms that designate how well aqueous solutions conduct electricity.

A4.text: Aqueous solutions that conduct electric current efficiently contain 'strong' electrolytes, while those that conduct poorly are attributable to weaker electrolytes.

A5.text: Non-electrolytes are substances that dissolve in water, yet maintain their molecular integrity: they do not dissociate into ions.
